article: When Prime Minister Winston Churchill was young, he attended a public school called Harrow. He was not a _ student. As a matter of fact, he'd have been thrown out of the school, if he hadn't been the son of a famous leader. However, he _ his study at Harrow, went on to the university, and then had a successful _ in the army. He later was elected Prime Minister and brought great honor to Britain. Toward the end of his period as Prime Minister, he was _ to address the young boys at Harrow, his old _ . He gave this short but moving speech: "Young men, never give up. Never give up! Never give up! _ !" Many people _ Abraham Lincoln to be the greatest president of all time. Yet it should be _ how many failures and defeats _ his early life. He grew up on a small farm. In those early years, his family _ had a penny and he had only one year of _ education. In 1832, he lost his job. In 1833 he _ in business. In 1835, the woman he loved died. In 1843 he was _ when he tried to enter the Congress . In 1856, he was defeated in the _ for vice president. In spite of these, he didn't give up , and he was elected President of the US in 1860. Personal history, education, situation--none of these can hold back a strong spirit. Some of the world's greatest people have _ huge problems and difficulties at some time in their lives, but they've gone on to do _ deeds. Bury him in the snows of Valley Forge, and you have a George Washington. Make a musical genius _ to hear, and you have a Ludwig van Beethoven. Call him _ to learn, and write him off as stupid, and you have an Albert Einstein.
